LEBANON

 
A Syrian in Greece: remembering better days, hoping to return one day
by Stella Nanou Athens, Greece

Leilah can't hold back the tears when she leafs through the family photo album. It's the only thing she managed to bring with her from Syria – a potent reminder of better days with her husband and six children in their home country. They led a happy and relatively comfortable life running a small village shop in northern Syria until the war broke out more than two years ago. Today, the 40-year-old Leilah lives in a dilapidated apartment in Athens with her children, two of whom were out looking for work when UNHCR visited. Her husband remained in Syria and she has no idea if he is safe or not...READ MORE

Number of Syrian refugees tops 1.5 million mark with many more expected
by Stella Nanou Athens, Greece

The UN refugee agency announced on Friday that the number of Syrian civilians who have fled their country to escape conflict has passed the 1.5 million mark. "The Syrian conflict continues to have a devastating impact on the lives of those who are forced to flee," added UNHCR spokesman Dan McNorton in Geneva. He told journalists in Geneva that the real number was probably much higher, adding that "this is due to concerns that some Syrians have regarding registration." The widening gap between the needs and resources available is a growing challenge, McNorton stressed. UNHCR has registered close to 1 million refugees since the beginning of the year – this is about 250,000 people each month. Early next month, the UN and NGOs are due to announce a revised funding appeal for the Syria crisis....READ MORE

UN Goodwill Ambassador Jesús Vázquez visits Syrian refugees in Jordan
by Greg Beals Za'atri Refugee Camp, Jordan

Popular Spanish TV presenter Jesús Vázquez visited Jordan this week to highlight the plight of hundreds of thousands of Syrian refugees, particularly the children, and to help raise urgently-needed funds for UNHCR's Syria crisis operation. "I'm here to listen to what you have to say so that I can help raise awareness in my country about your needs," the UNHCR Goodwill Ambassador told refugees on Tuesday in Za'atri camp, which is home to more than 100,000 people. "Even though the people of Spain are suffering from an economic crisis, they understand the drastic conditions you have been forced to endure," he said. "In Spain we have a crisis. Here the definition of crisis is life and death."...READ MORE

Because We Have Hope
by Greg Beals UNHCR

I met Samar yesterday at Zaatari Camp, after she had finished teaching a gaggle of young girls at a little school run by UNHCR's partner INTERSOS. Samar had been an elementary school teacher for 23 years and a principal for two years before she was forced to leave leave Syria. When she walks through the camp she often runs into the children that were under her care in her home town of Dara'a. I asked her about life in Dara'a during the conflict and her eyes began to well up. She told me about the day when eight members of her family were attacked by combatants while preparing the land to plant chickpeas. The telephone rang and they pleaded with her. "Don't send anyone to help us," her brother-in-law insisted. "We are already dead." As the man spoke, she looked down from her home onto the field and saw the explosions. "We could see them being killed even as we heard them die," she told me. Finally, the telephone went silent....READ MORE

Syria Refugee Crisis News 16/05/13
by Various via Storify

Death - this is the title of this drawing by a Syrian refugee child in Lebanon. The picture was taken by UNHCR's Sybella Wilkes who published the photo today on The Guardian's Witness platform. Al Jazeera reports that since the beginning of the conflict in Syria Za'atri camp in Jordan has become the second largest refugee camp in the world. By the end of the war, Jordan could host up to two million Syrian refugees said Minister of Interior Hussein Majali, who spoke alongside UNHCR's Andrew Harper at a press conference. Since the beginning of the year the number of Syrian refugees has increased by one million - UNHCR's Panos Moumtzis...READ MORE
